revision.comment: HTTPS security. [[User talk:DemonDays64|Tell me]] if there's an issue with my edit. (via [[WP:JWB]])
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikimedia list article}} {{Merge from|List of Dune secondary characters|List of Dune Bene Gesserit|discuss=Talk:List of Dune characters#Proposed merge with List of Dune secondary characters|date=December 2019}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Dune'' characters}} ''[[Dune (franchise)|Dune]]'' is a [[science fiction]] [[media franchise]] that originated with the 1965 novel ''[[Dune (novel)|Dune]]'' by American author [[Frank Herbert]]. ''Dune'' is frequently cited as the best-selling science fiction novel in history,<ref name="Touponce 119">{{cite book|last=Touponce |first=William F. |year=1988 |title=Frank Herbert |chapter=Herbert's Reputation |location=[[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]], [[Massachusetts]]|publisher=Twayne Publishers imprint, G. K. Hall & Co|page=119 |isbn=0-8057-7514-5|quote=''[[Locus (magazine)|Locus]]'' ran a poll of readers on April 15, 1975 in which ''Dune'' 'was voted the all-time best science-fiction novel â€¦ It has sold over ten million copies in numerous editions.'}}</ref><ref name="RIF">{{cite web | title=SCI FI Channel Auction to Benefit Reading Is Fundamental | url=http://pnnonline.org/article.php?sid=4302 |date=March 18, 2003 |via=pnnonline.org|quote=Since its debut in 1965, Frank Herbert's ''Dune'' has sold over 12 million copies worldwide, making it the best-selling science fiction novel of all time ... Frank Herbert's ''Dune'' saga is one of the greatest 20th Century contributions to literature.|accessdate=September 28, 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070928005501/http://pnnonline.org/article.php?sid=4302 |archivedate = September 28, 2007}}</ref> and won the 1966 [[Hugo Award]]<ref name="Hugo 1966">{{cite web|url=http://www.thehugoawards.org/hugo-history/1966-hugo-awards/|title=The Hugo Awards: 1966 |publisher=[[World Science Fiction Society]]|via=thehugoawards.org|accessdate=March 8, 2011}}</ref> as well as the inaugural [[Nebula Award for Best Novel]].<ref name="Nebula 1965">{{cite web|url=http://www.nebulaawards.com/index.php/awards/nebulas/P40/ |title=1965 Nebula Awards |publisher=[[Nebula Awards]]|via=nebulaawards.com |accessdate=March 17, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051217043400/http://nebulaawards.com/awards/archive/pastwin.htm |archivedate=December 17, 2005 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref> Herbert wrote five sequels before his death in 1986.<ref name="NYT 2006">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/24/books/review/Itzkoff.t.html|title=Across the Universe: ''Dune'' Babies|last=Itzkoff|first=Dave|authorlink=Dave Itzkoff|date=September 24, 2006|website=[[The New York Times]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151024031606/http://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/24/books/review/Itzkoff.t.html|archivedate=October 24, 2015|url-status=live|accessdate=April 14, 2018|df=}}</ref><ref name="Post-Gazette Obit">{{cite news | title=Frank Herbert, author of sci-fi best sellers, dies |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1129&dat=19860213&id=gQQOAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WG4DAAAAIBAJ&pg=6996,3769073 |work=[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]] |date=February 13, 1986 |accessdate=July 27, 2009}}</ref><ref name="SFD 2007-08">{{cite web|url=http://www.scifidimensions.com/Aug07/sandwormsofdune.htm |title=Audiobook Review: ''Sandworms of Dune'' by Brian Herbert & Kevin J Anderson |last=Snider |first=John C. |date=August 2007 |publisher=SciFiDimensions.com |accessdate=June 18, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080513064723/http://www.scifidimensions.com/Aug07/sandwormsofdune.htm |archivedate=May 13, 2008 |df= }}</ref> ''Dune'' was adapted into a [[Dune (1984 film)|1984 film]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9F06E2D71238F937A25751C1A962948260|title=Movie Review: ''Dune'' (1984) |last=Maslin|first=Janet|authorlink=Janet Maslin|date=December 14, 1984|work=The New York Times|accessdate=March 15, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.variety.com/review/VE1117790608.html?categoryid=31&cs=1&p=0 |title=Movie Review: ''Dune'' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=March 15, 2010 | date=January 1, 1984}}</ref> and a [[Frank Herbert's Dune|2000 television miniseries]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cinescape.com/0/editorial.asp?aff_id=0&this_cat=Television&action=page&type_id=&cat_id=&obj_id=26343 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080316172142/http://www.mania.com/dune-remaking-classic-novel_article_26343.html |archivedate=March 16, 2008 |title=''Dune'': Remaking the Classic Novel |first=Steve |last=Fritz |publisher=Cinescape.com |date=December 4, 2000 |accessdate=March 14, 2010}}</ref><ref name="NYT Stasio">{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/12/03/tv/cover-story-future-myths-adrift-in-the-sands-of-time.html?src=pm |title=Future Myths, Adrift in the Sands of Time |first=Marilyn |last=Stasio |work=The New York Times |date=December 3, 2000 |accessdate=August 21, 2015}}</ref> The first two sequels were presented as a [[Frank Herbert's Children of Dune|miniseries]] in 2003.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2003/03/16/tv/cover-story-where-spice-of-life-is-the-vital-variety.html?|title=Where Spice of Life Is the Vital Variety |last=Berger |first=Warren |date=March 16, 2003 |work=The New York Times |accessdate=January 26, 2010}}</ref>
Since 1999, Herbert's son [[Brian Herbert]] and science fiction author [[Kevin J. Anderson]] have published [[Dune prequel series|eleven prequel novels]], as well as two which complete the original ''Dune'' series.<ref name="NYT 2006"/>
==Frank Herbert works== Frank Herbert's ''[[Dune (novel)|Dune]]'' was published in 1965, and he wrote five sequels before his death in 1986: ''[[Dune Messiah]]'' (1969), ''[[Children of Dune]]'' (1976), ''[[God Emperor of Dune]]'' (1981), ''[[Heretics of Dune]]'' (1984), and ''[[Chapterhouse: Dune]]'' (1985).<ref name="NYT 2006"/> ''Dune'' follows [[Paul Atreides|Paul]], the scion of [[House Atreides]], as his family is thrown into the dangerous political intrigues centered on the [[desert planet]] [[Arrakis]], only known source of the oracular spice [[melange (fictional drug)|melange]], the most important and valuable substance in the universe. The series spans 5,000 years, focusing on Paul's various descendants.
=== House Atreides === * Arkie, Atreides House Trooper * [[Alia Atreides]], Paul's younger sister * [[Ghanima Atreides]], Paul's daughter and twin sister of Leto II * Ikonicre Atreides, majordomo to Leto II * [[Lady Jessica]], [[Bene Gesserit]] and [[concubinage|concubine]] of the Duke; mother of Paul and Alia * Duke [[Leto I Atreides]], head of [[House Atreides]] * Leto, first son of Paul and [[Chani]]; died as a toddler * [[Leto II Atreides]], Paul's son and twin brother of Ghanima * [[Moneo Atreides]], majordomo and result of the [[Leto II Atreides|God Emperor]]'s breeding program; father of [[Siona Atreides]] * [[Paul Atreides]], the Duke's son * [[Siona Atreides]], daughter of Moneo * [[Gurney Halleck]], staunchly loyal troubadour warrior of the Atreides * [[Thufir Hawat]], [[Mentat]] and Master of Assassins to House Atreides * [[Duncan Idaho]], Sword Master for House Atreides * Mattai, Atreides House Trooper * [[Wellington Yueh|Dr. Wellington Yueh]], [[Suk School|Suk doctor]] for the Atreides
=== House Harkonnen === * [[Abulurd Harkonnen|Abulurd Harkonnen II]], half-brother of the Baron; father of Glossu and Feyd * [[Feyd-Rautha|Feyd-Rautha Rabban]], nephew and heir of the Baron * [[Vladimir Harkonnen|Baron Vladimir Harkonnen]], head of [[House Harkonnen]] * Umman Kudu, Former Guard Captain * Iakin Nefud, Guard Captain * [[Glossu Rabban|Glossu 'Beast' Rabban]], older nephew of the Baron * [[Piter De Vries]], twisted [[Mentat]]
=== Imperial [[House Corrino]] === * [[Anirul]], Bene Gesserit wife of Shaddam IV * [[Aramsham]], Sardaukar Captain * [[Farad'n]], son of Princess Wensicia and grandson of Shaddam IV * [[Princess Irulan]], firstborn eldest daughter of Shaddam IV and Lady Anirul * [[Shaddam IV]], 81st Padishah Emperor of the Known Universe; last Corrino Emperor * [[Wensicia|Princess Wensicia]], third daughter of Shaddam IV and Lady Anirul * [[Count Fenring|Count Hasimir Fenring]], Imperial Spice Minister; Emperor Shaddam's closest friend and advisor * [[Pardot Kynes]], first Imperial Planetologist on Arrakis * Torynn, [[Sardaukar]] Levenbrech
=== Bene Gesserit === * [[Anteac|Tertius Eileen Anteac]] * [[Bellonda]] * [[Chenoeh|Sister Quintinius Violet Chenoeh]] * [[Margot Fenring|Lady Margot Fenring]], wife of [[Count Fenring|Count Hasimir Fenring]] * [[Luyseyal|Marcus Claire Luyseyal]] * [[Reverend Mother (Dune)|Reverend Mother]] [[Gaius Helen Mohiam]], the Emperor's [[Truthsayer]] and mentor of [[Lady Jessica]]. * [[Darwi Odrade]] * [[Schwangyu]] * [[Sheeana]] * [[Syaksa|Reverend Mother Syaksa]] * [[Tamalane]] * [[Miles Teg]] * [[Taraza (Dune)|Alma Mavis Taraza]] * [[Wanna (Dune)|Wanna]], wife of [[Wellington Yueh|Dr. Wellington Yueh]], [[Suk School|Suk doctor]]
=== Bene Tleilax === * Master [[Bijaz]] * Duro Nunepi, Tleilaxu Ambassador to Leto II * Ledden Pook, Tleilaxu Envoy * Master [[Scytale (Dune)|Scytale]] * Master [[Tylwyth Waff]] * Wose, Tleilaxu Envoy
=== Spacing Guild === * [[Norma Cenva]], inventor of foldspace technology; first [[Guild Navigator]] * [[Guild Navigator#Edric|Edric]], Navigator in the events of ''[[Dune Messiah]]'' * [[Guild Navigator#Edrik|Edrik]], Navigator in the events of ''[[Hunters of Dune]]'' and ''[[Sandworms of Dune]]'' * [[Guild Navigator#D'murr Pilru|D'murr Pilru]], Guild Navigator, twin brother of [[C'tair Pilru]] of [[Ix (Dune)|Ix]] * [[Aurelius Venport]], founder of VenKee enterprises, the ancestor of the Guild * [[Adrien Venport]], son of Aurelius Venport and Norma Cenva
=== Honored Matres === * [[Dama (Dune)|Dama]] * [[Logno]] * [[Murbella]]
=== Fremen === * [[Chani]], daughter of [[Liet-Kynes]] and Faroula; Paul's [[Fremen]] concubine * Chatt the Leaper, captain of the Fedaykin, leader of the death commandos who guard Muad'Dib * Dhuri, wife of Otheym * Farok * [[Faroula]], daughter of Heinar, wife of Warrick and then Liet-Kynes * Geoff, killed by Jamis in ritual combat * [[Harah]], wife of Jamis, the servant to Paul; later wife of Stilgar * [[Jamis (Dune)|Jamis]], killed by Paul in ritual combat * Kaleff, natural son of Geoff * [[Korba (Dune)|Korba]], [[Fedaykin]] commando * [[Lichna]], daughter of Otheym * [[Liet-Kynes]], the son of [[Pardot Kynes]], and the Imperial Planetologist on [[Arrakis]] * Orlop, natural son of Jamis * [[Otheym]], Fedaykin commando * [[Reverend Mother Ramallo]], Fremen Reverend Mother * [[Shadout Mapes]], housekeeper for the royal family of [[Arrakis]] * Shishakli, a squad leader of the Fedaykin * Shoab, Tharthar's brother * [[Stilgar]], Fremen naib, friend to Liet-Kynes * Tecrube, a Fremen and imperial clerk under Emperor Paul Atreides * Tharthar, one of Stilgar's wives * Turok, dies in a Harkonnen raid
=== Miscellaneous === * Abumojandia * Bannerjee, security officer under Emperor Paul Atreides * [[Hadi Benotto]], archaeologist * Djedida, KorbaÂ´s secretary * [[Esmar Tuek]], smuggler * [[Nayla (Dune)|Nayla]], [[Fish Speaker]] * Tandis, Imperial messenger under Emperor Paul Atreides * Topri, spy and rebel under Siona Atreides * Ulot, Rebel under Siona Atreides
==Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson works== {{main|Dune prequel series}}
Since 1999, Herbert's son Brian Herbert and author Kevin J. Anderson have published eleven prequel novels, collected in the series ''[[Prelude to Dune]]'' (1999â€“2001), ''[[Legends of Dune]]'' (2002â€“2004), ''[[Heroes of Dune]]'' (2008â€“2009), and ''[[Great Schools of Dune]]'' (2012â€“2016).<ref name="NYT 2006"/> They have also released two novelsâ€”''[[Hunters of Dune]]'' (2006) and ''[[Sandworms of Dune]]'' (2007)â€”which complete the original series.<ref name="NYT 2006"/>
=== House Atreides === * Estes Atreides, son of Vorian, twin of Kagin * [[Helena Atreides|Lady Helena Richese-Atreides]], mother of Leto I * Kagin Atreides, son of Vorian, twin of Estes * Kean Atreides, father of Paulus, son of Miklos * Miklos Atreides, father of Kean Atreides. * Duke [[Paulus Atreides]], father of Leto I * [[Victor Atreides]], son of Duke Leto and [[Kailea Vernius]] of [[Ix (Dune)|Ix]] * [[Vorian Atreides]], the founder of the house; son of the [[Titan (Dune)|Titan]] [[Agamemnon (Dune)|Agamemnon]]
=== House Harkonnen === * [[Abulurd Harkonnen]], grandson of Xavier * [[Dmitri Harkonnen]], father of Vladimir and Abulurd II * [[Xavier Harkonnen]], military leader during the [[Butlerian Jihad]] * Captain Kryubi, head of the Harkonnen House Guard * Kalo Whylls, Ambassador
=== Imperial [[House Corrino]] === * [[Elrood IX Corrino]], 80th Padishah Emperor of the Known Universe; father of Shaddam IV * [[Faykan Corrino]], founder of the Padishah Empire * Cando Garon, Sardaukar Commander; the son of Zum Garon * Zum Garon, [[Sardaukar|Imperial Sardaukar]] Supreme Bashar
=== [[House Moritani]] ([[Grumman (Dune)|Grumman]]) === * Trin Kronos * [[Hundro Moritani|Viscount Hundro Moritani]] * Lupino Ord, Ambassador of Grumman * Hiih Resser, Swordmaster of Ginaz serving House Moritani
=== House Richese === * Talis Balt, inventor * Premier Ein Calimar * Tenu Chobyn, inventor of the [[no-field]] * [[Edwina Richese|Lady Edwina Richese]], daughter of Elrood IX * [[Helena Atreides|Lady Helena Richese-Atreides]], married to Paulus Atreides, mother of Leto I * [[Ilban Richese|Count Ilban Richese]], head of [[House Richese]] * Haloa Rund, [[Mentat]] inventor
=== House Vernius and Ix === * Kobat, Ixian ambassador to Leto II * [[Malky (Dune)|Malky]] * [[Hwi Noree]], betrothed and Ixian ambassador to Leto II * [[C'tair Pilru]], son of Cammar; twin of D'murr * [[Cammar Pilru]], Ambassador of Ix * [[D'murr Pilru]], son of Cammar; twin of C'tair; [[Guild Navigator|Navigator]] for the [[Spacing Guild]] * [[Dominic Vernius|Earl Dominic Vernius]], head of [[House Vernius]] * [[Kailea Vernius|Lady Kailea Vernius]], daughter of Dominic and Shando; Rhombur's sister * [[Rhombur Vernius|Prince Rhombur Vernius]], eldest son of Dominic and Shando; cyborg ruler of [[Ix (Dune)|Ix]] * [[Shando Vernius|Lady Shando Balut-Vernius]], wife of Earl Vernius * [[Tessia]], Bene Gesserit, wife of Rhombur Vernius
=== House Taligari === * [[Tyros Reffa]], son of [[Elrood IX Corrino]]
=== Bene Gesserit === * [[Harishka]]
=== Bene Tleilax === * Master [[Ajidica|Hidar Fen Ajidica]] * Elder [[Burah (Dune)|Burah]] of the [[Lost Tleilaxu]] * [[Khrone]], Enhanced Face Dancer * [[Uxtal]] of the Lost Tleilaxu * Master Zaaf, Tleilaxu representative * Zoal, Face Dancer
=== Honored Matres === * [[Hellica]]
=== Fremen === * Bikouros, Fremen naib * Cahueit, Fremen naib * El'him Wormrider, son of Selim Wormrider * Fash, Fremen naib * Heinar, naib of Red Wall Sietch * Hobars, Fremen naib * Keke the Lame, Fremen naib and rebel * Legg, Fremen naib and rebel * Liet-chih, son of Warrick and Faroula * Naib Ishmael, leader of the Zensunni Free-Men, successor to the legend of Selim * Rajifiri, a Fremen rebel * Saajid, Fremen naib and rebel * [[Selim Wormrider]], leader of Zensunni outlaws on Arrakis, first wormrider * Takim, Fremen naib and rebel * Tasmin, Fremen naib and rebel * Uliet * Umbu, Fremen naib and rebel * Warrick, best friend of Liet-Kynes, killed in the [[spice agony]]
=== Sorceresses of Rossak === * [[Ticia Cenva]], sister of Norma, daughter of Iblis Ginjo * [[Zufa Cenva]], mother of Norma
=== Ginaz === * Whitmore Bludd * Mord Cour * Rivvy Dinari * Friedre Ginaz * Istian Goss, received spirit of Noret * [[Jool Noret]], legendary Ginaz mercenary, son of Zon Noret * Zon Noret, Ginaz mercenary famous at his time * Jammo Reed * Nar Trig * Jeh-Wu
=== Butlers === * Abulurd Butler, brother of Faykan; became [[Abulurd Harkonnen]] * [[Faykan Butler]], founder of [[Imperial House Corrino]]; renamed to [[Faykan Corrino]] * Livia Butler, wife of Manion Sr. and mother of Serena; abbess of the City of Interspection * [[Manion Butler]], ''Manion the Innocent'', martyred infant of Serena * Manion Butler Sr., father of Serena * [[Octa Butler]], wife of [[Xavier Harkonnen]] * [[Quentin Butler]], husband of Wandra * [[Rayna Butler]], founder of the [[Cult of Serena]] * Rikov Butler, governor of Parmentier and primero of the Jihad; father of Rayna * [[Serena Butler]], Priestess of the Jihad * [[Wandra Butler]], daughter of Xavier Harkonnen
=== Titans and Neo-Cymeks === '''Titans:''' * [[Agamemnon (Dune)|Agamemnon]] * [[Ajax (Dune)|Ajax]] * Alexander * [[Barbarossa (Dune)|Barbarossa]] * [[Dante (Dune)|Dante]] * [[Hecate (Dune)|Hecate]] * [[Juno (Dune)|Juno]] * Tamerlane * [[Tlaloc (Dune)|Tlaloc]] * [[Xerxes (Dune)|Xerxes]]
'''Neo-Cymeks:''' * [[Beowulf (Dune)|Beowulf]] * [[Quentin Butler]]
=== Thinking machines === {{main|Thinking machines (Dune)}} * [[Chirox]], reprogrammed by humans, used as a trainer on [[Ginaz]] * [[Erasmus (Dune)|Erasmus]], independent robot * [[Gilbertus Albans]], adopted human-son of Erasmus; founder of the [[Mentat (Dune)|Order of Mentats]] * [[Omnius]], the Evermind; leader of the machines * [[Seurat (Dune)|Seurat]], co-pilot to Vorian Atreides
=== Miscellaneous === * Pen Barlowe, smuggler * Lord [[Niko Bludd]] * [[Iblis Ginjo]], human trustee and later Grand Patriarch of the Holy Jihad * [[Tio Holtzman]] * Yorek Thurr, head of the [[Jipol]]
==References== <references />
